sentences.en: 'I neither want any thanks, nor merit any,'was the careless rejoinder.
sentences.cn: “ 我不需要感谢, 也不值得感谢, ” 回答是满不在乎的一句.

sentences.en: Among other things, Tanenbaum’s rejoinder contained the following: I still maintain the point that designing a monolithic kernel in 1991 is a fundamental error.
sentences.cn: 而另一边，谭邦宁是如此反驳道：我仍然认为在1991年设计一个宏内核简直就是错得体无完肤！

sentences.en: Bhagwati, the target of the 1998 rejoinder in Foreign Affairs, doesn't dispute that the change in IMF thinking unfolded gradually.
sentences.cn: 1998年《外交事务》上被反驳的对象，对国际货币基金组织的思想变化是逐步展开的没有异议。

sentences.en: But pause for a moment: if government will do a worse job running the banks, the rejoinder is "worse than whom"?
sentences.cn: 但让我们停下来想一下：如果政府在经营银行时做的更差，反驳的话就变成“比谁更差？”

sentences.en: He tried to think of a snappy rejoinder.
sentences.cn: 他试图想出一句简短的话来反驳。

sentences.en: In rejoinder, the abolitionists question the superior deterrent value of the death penalty.
sentences.cn: 废除死刑者在答辩中对死刑具有最大的威慑价值表示怀疑.

sentences.en: It brought a sharp rejoinder from the teacher.
sentences.cn: 这引起了老师的猛烈反驳.

sentences.en: She always has a witty rejoinder to any question.
sentences.cn: 她对待任何问题总能机智地回答。

words.tran_cn: 再加入；使…再结合；再回答
反驳；回答；（被告的）[法]第二次答辩

trans.tran_en: A rejoinder is a reply, especially a quick, witty, or critical one, to a question or remark
